thread.title_full: Celebrities React to NASA's New Planet Announcement - Read the Tweets

author: Just Jared
title: Celebrities React to NASA's New Planet Announcement - Read the Tweets
text:
Tweet Celebrities React to NASA's New Planet Announcement - Read the Tweets 
NASA Announced on Wednesday (February 22) that they recently found seven Earth-sized planets around a star outside of our solar system – and three are in a habitable zone. 
The “habitable zone” is the area around the parent star where a planet could have liquid water. 
This discovery is a big deal because it now sets a record for the greatest number of habitable planets found outside of a planet. All seven could potentially have liquid water, which is the key to our survival on other planets under the right atmospheric conditions. 
âThis discovery could be a significant piece in the puzzle of finding habitable environments, places that are conducive to life,â Thomas Zurbuchen , associate administrator of the agencyâs Science Mission Directorate in Washington, said in a statement. âAnswering the question âare we aloneâ is a top science priority and finding so many planets like these for the first time in the habitable zone is a remarkable step forward toward that goal.â Watch a video below to find out more info…

— William Shatner (@WilliamShatner) February 22, 2017 #asknasa Have youbern able to determine how many planets actually orbit TRAPPIST-1? Is it just the 7 or are there more?
